prefix: Approach the following multiple choice question the way a physician would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following multiple choice question the way a physician would. In a family, the father has widely spaced eyes, increased facial hair and deafness. One of the three children has deafness with similar facial features. The mother is normal. Which one of the following is most likely pattern of inheritance in this case?
1: Autosomal dominant
2: Autosomal recessive
3: X-linked dominant
4: X-linked recessive
gpt_response:
As a physician, when presented with a family history of widely spaced eyes, increased facial hair, deafness in the father and one of the children, and a normal mother, I would consider the most likely pattern of inheritance in this case. Given the presence of similar facial features and deafness in both the father and one of the children, this suggests a genetic condition that may be inherited. 

Based on the presentation of the symptoms, the most likely pattern of inheritance in this case would be X-linked recessive. X-linked recessive conditions are more likely to affect males as they only have one X chromosome, and if a male inherits a recessive allele for a condition located on the X chromosome, they will display symptoms. In this case, the father and one of the children (presumably a son) have deafness and facial features, while the mother, who is normal, would be a carrier of the recessive allele.

Therefore, the most likely pattern of inheritance in this case would be X-linked recessive.
